content: A {{productName}} account will be created for <1>{{email}}</1>. Please complete your registration:

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a greeting message when an account is created. It indicates that a user's account has been successfully created and provides details about the newly created account, such as the email address. This message appears in the UI after successful registration, prompting the user to complete their registration process.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'لـ' (li) after the email address is grammatically awkward and doesn't flow naturally in Arabic. A more natural phrasing would be something like 'لـ' followed by the product name.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: سيتم إنشاء حساب {{productName}} لـ {{email}} يرجى إكمال التسجيل:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'يرجى إكمال التسجيل' is a bit formal for this type of notification. A more conversational tone might be preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: الرجاء إكمال التسجيل

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The email placeholder <1>{{email}}</1> appears in a slightly awkward format. While technically correct, a simpler format is preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{email}}</1> could be simplified to just {{email}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Bulgarian translation uses "<1>" and "</1>" to mark variables, which is inconsistent with common practices. It should be consistent with the English "<1>" and "</1>"
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using more common variable markers like "{{}}" or a more standardized format that aligns with the rest of the application's localization.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'A {{productName}} account will be created' translates more accurately to 'Es wird ein {{productName}}-Konto erstellt'. Using 'Für' implies something is *for* the email, not that the account *is* being created *for* the email.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Es wird ein {{productName}}-Konto für <1>{{email}}</1> erstellt.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The German translation does not include the product name directly after the '{{productName}}' tag as it would read more naturally.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Es wird ein {{productName}} Konto für <1>{{email}}</1> erstellt.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'complete your registration' is a bit literal and can sound awkward in Spanish. A more natural phrasing would be 'finaliza tu registro' or 'concluye tu registro'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Por favor, finaliza tu registro:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Ole hyvä ja viimeistele rekisteröitymisesi:' is a bit formal and stiff for a typical registration completion message. A more conversational alternative would improve user experience.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Viimeistele rekisteröitymisesi / Suorita rekisteröitymisesi / Rekisteröitymisesi on valmis

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The spacing after the colon in 'Ti preghiamo di completare la tua registrazione:' is unusual. In Italian, it's more common to have a space before the colon.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ti preghiamo di completare la tua registrazione :

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation maintains the HTML tags <1>{{email}}</1> which are not idiomatic in Japanese and unnecessary.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the HTML tags. The email address should be directly incorporated into the sentence.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation maintains the HTML tags <1>{{email}}</1> from the English content. This is unnecessary and should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the HTML tags: {{email}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation retains the HTML tags <1> and </1> which are unnecessary and should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ບັນຊີ {{productName}} ຈະຖືກສ້າງຂຶ້ນສໍາລັບ {{email}}. ກະລຸນາຕື່ມການລົງທະບຽນຂອງທ່ານ:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation preserves the HTML tags <1> and </1>, which are not necessary and might interfere with rendering.  These tags are purely for context in the English source and should be removed from the Polish translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the HTML tags <1> and </1> from the Polish translation. The final Polish text should read: Konto {{productName}} zostanie utworzone dla adresu {{email}}. Zakończ rejestrację:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'Please complete your registration:' translates more naturally as 'Vă rugăm să finalizați înregistrarea:' or 'Finalizați înregistrarea:' The current translation 'Finalizați inregistrarea activă:' includes 'activă' (active) which is unnecessary and changes the meaning slightly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Finalizați înregistrarea:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation uses a space before the opening angle bracket '<' which is not standard.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change '<1>{{email}}</1>' to '<1>{{email}}</1>'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Sinhala translation retains the HTML tags `<1>{{email}}</1>` from the English content. These tags are not necessary in Sinhala and should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` from the Sinhala translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovenian translation retains the HTML-like tags `<1>{{email}}</1>` which is unnecessary and unconventional for Slovenian text.  The tags should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Račun {{productName}} bo ustvarjen za {{email}}. Prosimo, dokončajte registracijo:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation "{{productName}} налог ће бити креиран за <1>{{email}}</1>." incorrectly translates 'A {{productName}} account will be created for'. The word 'налог' (nalog) means 'account', but the verb 'креиран' implies something is being *created* in a more active sense. The English original uses a more passive 'will be created'. A more accurate translation would emphasize the passive voice.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{productName}} налог *ће бити* креиран за <1>{{email}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'завшите' is incorrect. It appears to be a misspelling.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: завршите

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'завшите' (incorrectly spelled) is a poor translation of 'Please complete your registration'. 'Please complete' is more accurately translated as something more formal, given the context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Молимо вас да завршите

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'nalog' while technically meaning 'account' in this context might be better translated as 'račun' for a more natural and common usage in Serbian when referring to online accounts.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{productName}} račun će biti kreiran za <1>{{email}}</1>. Molimo vas zavšite vašu registraciju:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence 'Molimo vas zavšite vašu registraciju' can be improved for better flow and a more professional tone.  The repetition of 'vas' is slightly awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Molimo vas da završite vašu registraciju.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Ukrainian translation lacks the contextual pronoun 'you' after 'complete your registration'. While implied, it's more natural to include it for clarity.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Для <1>{{email}}</1> буде створено обліковий запис {{productName}}. Завершіть реєстрацію, <2>ви</2>:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets <1> and </1> are not standard and should be removed, as they don't contribute to the meaning and can cause rendering issues.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the angle brackets around {{email}}. The correct translation would be: “Một tài khoản {{productName}} sẽ được tạo cho {{email}}. Xin vui lòng hoàn tất đăng ký của bạn:”

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word '帐户' (Zhanghu) is a more formal and less common translation for 'account' in this context.  '账号' (zhànghào) is generally preferred for online accounts.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 将为 <1>{{email}}</1>创建{{productName}}账号。请完成您的注册：
